ancestry.name: Goblin
languages: Additional languages equal to your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from {@language Draconic|PC1}, {@language Dwarven|PC1}, {@language Gnomish|PC1}, {@language Halfling|PC1}, {@language Kholo|PC1}, {@language Orcish|PC1}, and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).

features.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in darkness and dim light just as well as you can see in bright light, though your vision in darkness is in black and white.

flavor: The convoluted histories other people cling to don't interest goblins. These small folk live in the moment, and they prefer tall tales over factual records. Goblin virtues are about being present, creative, and honest. They strive to lead fulfilled lives, rather than worrying about how their journeys will end. To tell stories, not nitpick the facts. To be small, but dream big. Many goblins enjoy simpler delights like songs, fire, and eating, and hate reading, dogs, and horses. Other goblins might have more complex pursuits, though, such as tinkering with scraps or concocting snacks and explosives from most anything.
If you want a character who is eccentric, enthusiastic, and fun-loving, you should play a goblin.
heritageInfo: Goblins, especially those of different tribes, have all sorts of physiological differences, which they often discover only through hazardous "experiments." Choose one of the following goblin heritages at 1st level.

heritage.name: Charhide Goblin
entries: Your ancestors have always had a connection to fire and a thicker skin, which allows you to resist burning. You gain fire resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). You can also recover from being on fire more easily. Your flat check to remove {@condition persistent damage|PC1|persistent fire damage} is DC 10 instead of DC 15, which is reduced to DC 5 if another creature uses a particularly appropriate action to help.

heritage.name: Irongut Goblin
entries: You can subsist on food that most folks would consider spoiled. You can keep yourself fed with poor meals in a settlement as long as garbage is readily available, without using the {@action Subsist|PC1} downtime activity. You can eat and drink things when you are {@condition sickened|PC1}.

You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against afflictions, against gaining the {@condition sickened|PC1} condition, and to remove the {@condition sickened|PC1} condition. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save affected by this bonus, you get a critical success instead. All these benefits apply only when the affliction or condition resulted from something you ingested.

heritage.name: Razortooth Goblin
entries: Your family's teeth are formidable weapons. You gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. Your jaws are in the {@group brawling} group and have the {@trait finesse} and {@trait unarmed} traits.

heritage.name: Snow Goblin
entries: You are acclimated to living in frigid lands and have skin ranging from sky blue to navy in color, as well as blue fur. You gain cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). You treat environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on).

heritage.name: Unbreakable Goblin
entries: You're able to bounce back from injuries easily due to an exceptionally thick skull, cartilaginous bones, or some other mixed blessing. You gain 10 Hit Points from your ancestry instead of 6. When you fall, reduce the falling damage you take as though you had fallen half the distance.

summary.text: Goblins are a short, scrappy, energetic people who have spent millennia maligned and feared.
